<h4>4.1</h4>
<ul>
<li><a href="http://gndev.info/shortcodes-ultimate/metro-skins/" rel="nofollow">5 metro skins</a></li>
<li>New screencast &#8211; <a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kCWyO2F7jTw" rel="nofollow">How to create image gallery</a></li>
<li>New attribute &#8220;center&#8221; for [button]. Buttons can now be centered on the page</li>
<li>Updated [frame]. Now it can contain other shortcodes</li>
<li>Updated caching mechanism. Cache now will be reseted on plugin activation</li>
<li>Fixed many PHP warnings when debug mode enabled</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [media]. Shortcode has basic support for youtube and vimeo videos</li>
<li>Fixed bug with hidden single [tab]</li>
<li>Added attribute &#8220;active&#8221; for tabs container. This option allows you to select tab number that will be open by default</li>
<li>Fixd button style 3D</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [frame]</li>
<li>Fixed [column] margins</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [tabs]. Now it accepts style=3 and vertical attributes</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [spoiler]. Now it accepts 0 and 1 as values for attribute open. Also, it now accepts style attribute (1, 2, default, fancy, simple)</li>
<li>Added custom CSS import from previous versions. Styles will be imported automatically and prepended to the existing CSS-code</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [highlight]. Now it accepts bg and background attributes</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [label]. Now it accepts style and type attributes</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [dropcap]. Now it accepts 1, 2 and 3 as style values</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [permalink]. Now it accepts p and id attributes</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [button]. Need to test</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [members]. Now it accepts style and login attributes</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [box]. Now it accepts color and box_color attributes</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [note]. Now it accepts color and note_color attributes</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [column]. Now it accepts attribute last and can be not wrapped with [row]</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [document]. Now it accepts file and url attributes</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0</h4>
<ul>
<li><a href="http://gndev.info/shortcodes-ultimate/" rel="nofollow">Official plugin page</a></li>
<li><a href="http://gndev.info/shortcodes-ultimate/maker/" rel="nofollow">Premium add-on for creating custom shortcodes</a></li>
<li>Plugin based on <a href="https://github.com/gndev/sunrise" rel="nofollow">Sunrise Plugin Framework</a></li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/gndev/shortcodes-ultimate" rel="nofollow">GitHub repo</a>. Now you can easily fork and modify best plugin in the world (:</li>
<li>Brand new Shortcode Generator, <a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DR2c266yWEA" rel="nofollow">demo video</a></li>
<li><a href="http://gndev.info/kb/shortcodes-ultimate-api-overview/" rel="nofollow">Shortcodes API</a></li>
<li>Completely reorganized code. Added and removed some shortcodes</li>
<li>For security maniacs: timthumb.php replaced by native WordPress mechanism</li>
<li>For speed-up maniacs: completely rewritten assets mechanism. Now css and js files included on page depend on used shortcodes</li>
<li>Added new shortcode [posts]. This is awesome and flexible mechanism to display your content in many different ways</li>
<li>Now you can create your own custom skins for shortcodes</li>
<li>Columns, google maps, google document viewer, youtube player, vimeo player and custom audio player is now fully responsive</li>
</ul>

.zip";s:5:"5.2.0";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.5.2.0.zip";s:5:"5.3.0";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.5.3.0.zip";s:5:"5.4.0";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.5.4.0.zip";s:5:"5.4.1";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.5.4.1.zip";s:5:"5.5.0";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.5.5.0.zip";s:5:"5.6.0";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.5.6.0.zip";s:5:"5.6.1";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.5.6.1.zip";s:5:"trunk";s:62:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:29:"https://paypal.me/anovladimir";s:5:"icons";a:2:{s:2:"1x";s:72:"https://ps.w.org/shortcodes-ultimate/assets/icon-128x128.png?rev=1760590";s:2:"2x";s:72:"https://ps.w.org/shortcodes-ultimate/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=1760590";}s:18:"author_block_count";i:0;s:19:"author_block_rating";i:98;s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}s:7:"markets";s:3:"any";s:8:"category";a:1:{s:3:"any";s:4:"more";}s:3:"new";i:1;}s:20:"fast-velocity-minify";a:31:{s:4:"name";s:20:"Fast Velocity Minify";s:4:"slug";s:20:"fast-velocity-minify";s:7:"version";s:5:"2.7.7";s:6:"author";s:50:"<a href="http://fastvelocity.com">Raul Peixoto</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:38:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/alignak";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.7";s:6:"tested";s:5:"5.3.2";s:12:"requires_php";s:3:"5.6";s:6:"rating";i:94;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:130;i:4;i:3;i:3;i:1;i:2;i:4;i:1;i:6;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:144;s:15:"support_threads";i:29;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:25;s:10:"downloaded";i:1561345;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2019-10-14 9:04pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2016-06-21";s:8:"homepage";s:23:"http://fastvelocity.com";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:3871:"<p>WP speed optimization plugin for developers and advanced users. This plugin reduces HTTP requests by merging CSS &amp; Javascript files into groups of files, while attempting to use the least amount of files as possible. It minifies CSS and JS files with PHP Minify (no extra requirements).</p>
<p>Minification is done on the frontend during the first uncached request. Once the first request is processed, any other pages that require the same set of CSS and JavaScript files, will be served that same (static) cache file.</p>
<p>This plugin includes options for developers and advanced users, however the default settings should work just fine for most sites.<br />
Kindly read our faqs about possible issues with you theme or specific plugins.</p>
<h4>Aditional Optimization</h4>
<p>I can offer you aditional <code>custom made</code> optimization on top of this plugin. If you would like to hire me, please visit my profile links for further information.</p>
<h4>Features</h4>
<ul>
<li>Merge JS and CSS files into groups to reduce the number of HTTP requests</li>
<li>Google Fonts merging, inlining and optimization</li>
<li>Handles scripts loaded both in the header &amp; footer separately</li>
<li>Keeps the order of the scripts even if you exclude some files from minification</li>
<li>Supports localized scripts (https://codex.wordpress.org/Function_Reference/wp_localize_script)</li>
<li>Minifies CSS and JS with PHP Minify only, no third party software or libraries needed.</li>
<li>Option to defer JavaScript and CSS files, either globally or pagespeed insights only.</li>
<li>Creates static cache files in the uploads directory.</li>
<li>Preserves your original files, by duplicating and copying those files to the uploads directory </li>
<li>View the status and detailed logs on the WordPress admin page.</li>
<li>Option to Minify HTML, remove extra info from the header and other optimizations.</li>
<li>Ability to turn off minification for JS, CSS or HTML (purge the cache to see it)</li>
<li>Ability to turn off CSS or JS merging completely (so you can debug which section causes conflicts and exclude the offending files)</li>
<li>Ability to manually ignore JavaScript or CSS files that conflict when merged together (please report if you find some)</li>
<li>Support for conditional scripts and styles, as well as inlined code that depends on the handles</li>
<li>Support for multisite installations (each site has its own settings)</li>
<li>Support for gzip_static on Nginx</li>
<li>Support for preconnect and preload headers</li>
<li>CDN option, to rewrite all static assets inside the JS or CSS files</li>
<li>WP CLI support to check stats and purge the cache</li>
<li>Auto purging of cache files for W3 Total Cache, WP Supercache, WP Rocket, Cachify, Comet Cache, Zen Cache, LiteSpeed Cache, Nginx Cache (by Till Krüss ), SG Optimizer, HyperCache, Cache Enabler, Breeze (Cloudways), Godaddy Managed WordPress Hosting and WP Engine (read the FAQs)</li>
<li>and some more&#8230;</li>
</ul>
<h4>WP-CLI Commands</h4>
<ul>
<li>Purge all caches: <code>wp fvm purge</code></li>
<li>Purge all caches on a network site: <code>wp --url=blog.example.com fvm purge</code></li>
<li>Purge all caches on the entire network (linux): <code>wp site list --field=url | xargs -n1 -I % wp --url=% fvm purge</code></li>
<li>Get cache size: <code>wp fvm stats</code></li>
<li>Get cache size on a network site: <code>wp --url=blog.example.com fvm stats</code></li>
<li>Get cache size on each site (linux): <code>wp site list --field=url | xargs -n1 -I % wp --url=% fvm stats</code></li>
</ul>
<h4>Notes</h4>
<ul>
<li>The JavaScript minification is by <a href="https://github.com/matthiasmullie/minify" rel="nofollow">PHP Minify</a></li>
<li>Compatible with Nginx, HHVM and PHP 7</li>
<li>Minimum requirements are PHP 5.5 and WP 4.4, from version 1.4.0 onwards</li>
</ul>
";s:12:"installation";s:318:"<ol>
<li>Upload the plugin folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory or upload the zip within WordPress</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the <code>Plugins</code> menu in WordPress</li>
<li>Configure the options under: <code>Settings &gt; Fast Velocity Minify</code> and that&#8217;s it.</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:14305:"
<h4>Can I update plugins and themes after installing FVM?</h4>
<p>
<p>FVM doesn&#8217;t touch your original files. It copies those files to the cache directory, minifies that copy and merges them together under a different name. If you install new plugins, change themes or do plugin updates, FVM will purge its cache as well as some of the most popular cache plugins.</p>
</p>
<h4>After installing, why did my site feels slow to load?</h4>
<p>
<p>Please see the question below.</p>
</p>
<h4>Why are there lots of JS and CSS files listed on the status page and why is the cache directory taking so much space?</h4>
<p>
<p>Some themes combine and enqueue their CSS using a PHP script with a query string that changes on every pageload&#8230; (this is to bust cache, but it&#8217;s bad practice since it prevents caching at all). When FVM sees a different url being enqueued, it will consider that as a new file and try to create a new set of files on every pageview as well. You must then exclude that dynamic url via the Ignore List on the settings for your cache to be efficient and stop growing. Also note, if your pages enqueue different styles or  javascript in different pages (fairly common), that is &#8220;one set&#8221; of files to be merged. Pay attention to the logs header and look for the page url where those files have ben generated. If you have multiple files generated for the same url, you have some css/js that keeps changing on every pageview (and thus needs exclusion).</p>
</p>
<h4>How can I exclude certain assets?</h4>
<p>
<p>Each line on the ignore list will try to match a substring against all CSS or JS files, for example <code>//yoursite.com/wp-content/plugins/some-plugin/js/</code> will ignore all files inside that directory. You can also shorten the URL like <code>/some-plugin/js/</code> and then it will match any css or js URL that has <code>/some-plugin/js/</code> on the path. Obviously, doing <code>/js/</code> would match any files inside any &#8220;/js/&#8221; directory and in any location, so to avoid unexpected situations please always use the longest, most specific path you can use. There is no need to use asterisks or regex code (it won&#8217;t work).</p>
</p>
<h4>Why is the ignore list not working?</h4>
<p>
<p>The ignore list &#8220;is&#8221; working, just try to use partial paths (see previous faq) and use relative urls only without any query vars.</p>
</p>
<h4>Is it compatible with other caching plugins?</h4>
<p>
<p>You must disable any features on your theme or cache plugins which perform minification of css, html and js. Double minification not only slows the whole process, but also has the high potential of causing conflicts in javascript. The plugin will try to automatically purge several popular cache plugins, however if you have a cache on the server side (some hosting services have this) you may need to purge it manually, after you purge FVM to see the results you expect. The automatic purge is active for the following plugins and hosting: W3 Total Cache, WP Supercache, WP Rocket, Cachify, Comet Cache, Zen Cache, LiteSpeed Cache, Cache Enabler, SG Optimizer, Breeze (Cloudways), Godaddy Managed WordPress Hosting and WP Engine</p>
</p>
<h4>Do you recommend a specific Cache Plugin?</h4>
<p>
<p>Currently we recommend the &#8220;Cache Enabler&#8221; plugin, for it&#8217;s simplicity, compatibility with most systems and performance. Alternatively, W3 Total Cache is a great choice as well.</p>
</p>
<h4>Is it resource intensive, or will it use too much CPU on my shared hosting plan?</h4>
<p>
<p>Unless you are not excluding dynamic CSS files that change the url in every pageload, its not heavy at all. On the first run, each single file is minified into an intermediate cache. When a new group of CSS/JS files is found on a new page, it reuses those files and merges them into a new static cache file. All pages that request the same group of CSS or JS files will also make use of that file, thus regeneration only happens once. In addition, gz and br files will be pre-compressed (if supported).</p>
</p>
<h4>How do I use the pre-compressed files with gzip_static or brotli_static on Nginx?</h4>
<p>
<p>When we merge and minify the css and js files, we also create a <code>.gz</code> file to be used with <code>gzip_static</code> on Nginx. You need to enable this feature on your Nginx configuration file if you want to make use of it. Likewise, if you have Nginx compiled with brotli and have enabled the php-ext-brotli extension for PHP, you can enable the brotli_static option and FVM will also generate .br files for you 🙂</p>
</p>
<h4>Is it compatible with multisites?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, it generates a new cache file for every different set of JS and CSS requirements it finds, but you must enable and configure FVM settings for each site in your network separatly (no global settings for all sites).</p>
</p>
<h4>Is it compatible with AdSense and other ad networks?</h4>
<p>
<p>If you are just inserting ads on your pages, yes. If you are using a custom script to inject those ads, please double check if it works.</p>
</p>
<h4>After installing, why are some images, sections, sliders, galleries, menus (etc) not working?</h4>
<p>
<p>a) You cannot do double minification, so make sure you have disabled any features on your theme or other plugins that perform minification of css, html and js files.</p>
<p>b) If you enabled the option to defer JS or CSS, please note that some themes and plugins need jQuery and other libraries to be render blocking. If you enable the option to defer, any javascript code on the page will trigger an &#8220;undefined&#8221; error on the google chrome console log after page load.</p>
<p>c) The plugin relies on PHP Minify to minify JavaScript and css files, however it is not a perfect library and there are plugins that are already minified and do not output a &#8220;min.js&#8221; or &#8220;min.css&#8221; filename (and end up being minified again). Try to disable minification on JS and CSS files and purge the cache, then either dequeue it and enqueue an alternative file or add it to the ignore list.</p>
<p>d) Sometimes a plugin conflicts with another when merged (look at google chrome console log for hints). Try to disable CSS processing first and see if it works. Disable JS processing second and see if it works. Try to disable HTML minification last and see if it works. If one of those work, you know there is a conflict when merging/minifying.</p>
<p>e) If you have a conflict, try to add each CSS and each JS file to the ignore list one by one, until you find the one that causes the conflict. If you have no idea of which files to add, check the log file on the &#8220;status page&#8221; for a list of files being merged into each generated file.</p>
<p>f) If you coded some inline JS code that depends on a JS file being loaded before it&#8217;s execution (render blocking), try to save that code into an external file and enqueue it as a dependency. It will be merged together and run after the other file, thus no longer being &#8220;undefined&#8221;.</p>
</p>
<h4>Why are some of the CSS and JS files not being merged?</h4>
<p>
<p>The plugin only processes JS and CSS files enqueued using the official WordPress api method &#8211; https://developer.wordpress.org/themes/basics/including-css-javascript/ -as well as files from the same domain (unless specified on the settings).</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I merge files from other domains?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes and no. You can for example, merge js files such as jQuery if they are loading from a CDN and it will work, because it doesn&#8217;t matter where those files are being served from. However, stuff like Facebook and other social media widgets, as well as tracking codes, widgets and so on, cannot usually be merged and cached locally as they may load something different on every pageload, or anytime they change something. Ads and widgets make your site slow, so make sure you only use the minimum necessary plugins and widgets.</p>
</p>
<h4>How to undo all changes done by the plugin?</h4>
<p>
<p>The plugin itself does not do any &#8220;changes&#8221; to your site and all original files are untouched. It intercepts the enqueued CSS and JS files just before printing your HTML, copies them and enqueues the newly optimized cached version of those files to the frontend. As with any plugin&#8230; simply disable or uninstall the plugin, purge all caches you may have in use (plugins, server, cloudflare, etc.) and the site will go back to what it was before installing it. The plugin does not delete anything from the database or modify any of your files.</p>
</p>
<h4>I have disabled or deleted the plugin but my design is still broken!</h4>
<p>
<p>Some &#8220;cheap&#8221; (or sometimes expensive) &#8220;optimized&#8221; hosting providers, implement a (misconfigured) aggressive cache on their servers that caches PHP code execution and PHP files. I&#8217;ve seen people completely deleting all WordPress files from their host via SFTP/FTP and the website kept working fine for hours. Furthermore, very often they rate limit your cache purge requests&#8230; so if you delete FVM and are still seeing references to FVM files on the &#8220;view-source:https://example.com&#8221; please be patient and contact your web hosting to purge all caches. Providers known to have this issue are some plans on hostgator and iPage (please report others if you find them).</p>
</p>
<h4>Why is my Visual Composer or Page Editor not working?</h4>
<p>
<p>Some plugins and themes need to edit the layout and styles on the frontend. If you have trouble with page editors, please enable the &#8220;Fix Page Editors&#8221; option on FVM and purge your caches. Note: You will only see the FVM minification working when you&#8217;re logged out or using another browser after this setting.</p>
</p>
<h4>What are the recommended cloudflare settings for this plugin?</h4>
<p>
<p>On the &#8220;Speed&#8221; tab, deselect the Auto Minify for JavaScript, CSS and HTML as well as the Rocket Loader option as there is no benefit of using them with our plugin (we already minify things). Those options can also break the design due to double minification or the fact that the Rocket Loader is still experimental (you can read about that on the &#8220;Help&#8221; link under each selected option on cloudflare).</p>
</p>
<h4>How can I load CSS async?</h4>
<p>
<p>You are probably a developer if you are trying this. The answer is: make sure FVM is only generating 1 CSS file, because &#8220;async&#8221; means multiple files will load out of order (however CSS needs order most of the times). If FVM is generating more than 1 CSS file per mediatype, try to manually dequeue some of the CSS files that are breaking the series on FVM (such as external enqueued files), or add their domain to the settings to be merged together. Please note&#8230; this is an advanced option for skilled developers. Do not try to fiddle with these settings if you are not one, as it will almost certainly break your site layout and functionality.</p>
</p>
<h4>Why is FVM using defer instead of async javascript?</h4>
<p>
<p>The answer is simple. For compatibility reasons and to avoid some undefined javascript errors, we need to preserve the order of scripts. Async means that any js files will load in parallel without waiting for each other or without following a specific order. If FVM generates multiple JS files for your site, using Async could cause footer scripts to load before the header scripts in an inconsistent manner. By using defer, we make sure the scripts load in order, as defined by each plugin and theme developer.<br />
Your ads or scripts wich are already specifically async will continue to be so, unless you specifically mark them to be merged as well.</p>
</p>
<h4>I have a complaint or I need support right now.</h4>
<p>
<p>Before getting angry because you have no answer within a few hours (even with paid plugins, sometimes it takes weeks&#8230;), please be informed about how wordpress.org and the plugins directory work. The plugins directory is an open source, free service where developers and programmers contribute (on their free time) with plugins that can be downloaded and installed by anyone &#8220;at their own risk&#8221; and are all released under the GPL license. While all plugins have to be approved and reviewed by the WordPress team before being published (for dangerous code, spam, etc.) this does not change the license or add any warranty. All plugins are provided as they are, free of charge and should be used at your own risk (so you should make backups before installing any plugin or performing updates) and it is your sole responsibility if you break your site after installing a plugin from the plugins directory. For a full version of the license, please read: https://wordpress.org/about/gpl/</p>
</p>
<h4>Why haven&#8217;t you replied to my topic on the support forum yet?</h4>
<p>
<p>Support is provided by plugin authors on their free time and without warranty of a reply, so you can experience different levels of support level from plugin to plugin. As the author of this plugin I strive to provide support on a daily basis and I can take a look and help you with some issues related with my plugin, but please note that this is done out of my goodwill and in no way I have any legal or moral obligation for doing this. Sometimes I am extremely busy and may take a few days to reply, but I will always reply.</p>
</p>
<h4>But I really need fast support right now, is there any other way?</h4>
<p>
<p>I am also available for hiring if you need custom-made speed optimizations. After you have installed the plugin, check the &#8220;Help&#8221; tab for contact information, or check my profile links here on WordPress.</p>
</p>
<h4>Where can I report bugs?</h4>
<p>
<p>You can get support on the official WordPress plugin page at https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/fast-velocity-minify<br />
Alternatively, you can reach me via info (at) fastvelocity.com for security or other vulnerabilities.</p>
</p>
<h4>How can I donate to the plugin author?</h4>
<p>
<p>If you would like to donate any amount to the plugin author (thank you in advance), you can do it via PayPal at https://goo.gl/vpLrSV</p>
</p>

Bee";s:4:"slug";s:12:"antispam-bee";s:7:"version";s:5:"2.9.1";s:6:"author";s:57:"<a href="https://pluginkollektiv.org">pluginkollektiv</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:46:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/pluginkollektiv";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.5";s:6:"tested";s:5:"5.2.5";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:96;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:147;i:4;i:2;i:3;i:1;i:2;i:1;i:1;i:6;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:157;s:15:"support_threads";i:10;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:7;s:10:"downloaded";i:3057978;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2019-09-15 5:17pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2009-01-10";s:8:"homepage";s:43:"https://wordpress.org/plugins/antispam-bee/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:2567:"<p>Say Goodbye to comment spam on your WordPress blog or website. <em>Antispam Bee</em> blocks spam comments and trackbacks effectively, without captchas and without sending personal information to third party services. It is free of charge, ad-free and 100% GDPR compliant.</p>
<p><a href="http://coderisk.com/wp/plugin/antispam-bee/RIPS-J23dtT1_jC" rel="nofollow"></a></p>
<h3>Feature/Settings Overview</h3>
<ul>
<li>Trust approved commenters.</li>
<li>Trust commenters with a Gravatar.</li>
<li>Consider the comment time.</li>
<li>Allow comments only in a certain language.</li>
<li>Block or allow commenters from certain countries.</li>
<li>Treat BBCode as spam.</li>
<li>Validate the IP address of commenters.</li>
<li>Use regular expressions.</li>
<li>Search local spam database for commenters previously marked as spammers.</li>
<li>Notify admins by e-mail about incoming spam.</li>
<li>Delete existing spam after n days.</li>
<li>Limit approval to comments/pings (will delete other comment types).</li>
<li>Select spam indicators to send comments to deletion directly.</li>
<li>Optionally exclude trackbacks and pingbacks from spam detection.</li>
<li>Optionally spam-check comment forms on archive pages.</li>
<li>Display spam statistics on the dashboard, including daily updates of spam detection rate and a total of blocked spam comments.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Support</h3>
<ul>
<li>Community support via the <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/antispam-bee">support forums on wordpress.org</a></li>
<li>Read <a href="https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee/wiki/en-Documentation" rel="nofollow">the documentation</a></li>
<li>We don’t handle support via e-mail, Twitter, GitHub issues etc.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Contribute</h3>
<ul>
<li>Active development of this plugin is handled <a href="https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee" rel="nofollow">on GitHub</a>.</li>
<li>Pull requests for documented bugs are highly appreciated.</li>
<li>If you think you’ve found a bug (e.g. you’re experiencing unexpected behavior), please post at the <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/antispam-bee">support forums</a> first.</li>
<li>If you want to help us translate this plugin you can do so <a href="https://translate.wordpress.org/projects/wp-plugins/antispam-bee" rel="nofollow">on WordPress Translate</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Credits</h3>
<ul>
<li>Author: <a href="https://sergejmueller.github.io/" rel="nofollow">Sergej Müller</a></li>
<li>Maintainers: <a href="https://pluginkollektiv.org" rel="nofollow">pluginkollektiv</a></li>
</ul>
";s:12:"installation";s:554:"<ul>
<li>If you don’t know how to install a plugin for WordPress, <a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/Managing_Plugins#Installing_Plugins" rel="nofollow">here’s how</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Requirements</h3>
<ul>
<li>PHP 5.2.4 or greater</li>
<li>WordPress 3.8 or greater</li>
</ul>
<h3>Settings</h3>
<p>After you have activated <em>Antispam Bee</em> the plugin will block spam comments out of the box. However, you may want to visit <em>Settings → Antispam Bee</em> to configure your custom set of anti-spam options that works best for your site.</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:2539:"
<h4>Does Antispam Bee work with Jetpack, Disqus Comments and other comment plugins?</h4>
<p>
<p>Antispam Bee works best with default WordPress comments. It is not compatible with Jetpack or Disqus Comments as those plugins load the comment form within an iframe. Thus Antispam Bee can not access the comment form directly.<br />
It also won’t work with any AJAX-powered comment forms.</p>
</p>
<h4>Does Antispam Bee store any private user data, and is it compliant with GDPR?</h4>
<p>
<p>Antispam Bee is developed in Europe. You might have heard we can be a bit nitpicky over here when it comes to privacy. The plugin does not save private user data and is 100% compliant with GDPR.</p>
</p>
<h4>Will I have to edit any theme templates to get Antispam Bee to work?</h4>
<p>
<p>No, the plugin works as is. You may want to configure your favorite settings, though.</p>
</p>
<h4>Does Antispam Bee work with shortened IPs?</h4>
<p>
<p>Generally yes. However, commissioning the Antispam Bee plugin for canceled or shortened IP addresses in comment metadata is not recommended. Because the name and the e-mail address of the comments are not unique, an IP address is the only reliable measure. The more complete the stored IP addresses, the more reliable the assignment or detection of spam.</p>
</p>
<h4>How can I submit undetected spam?</h4>
<p>
<p>If the antispam plugin has passed some spam comments, these comments can be reported for analysis. A <a href="http://goo.gl/forms/ITzVHXkLVL" rel="nofollow">Google table</a> was created for this purpose.</p>
</p>
<h4>Antispam Bee with Varnish?</h4>
<p>
<p>If WordPress is operated with Apache + Varnish, the actual IP address of the visitors does not appear in WordPress. Accordingly the Antispam-Plugin lacks the base for the correct functionality. An adaptation in the Varnish configuration file /etc/varnish/default.vcl provides a remedy and forwards the original (not from Apache) IP address in the HTTP header X-Forwarded-For:</p>
<pre><code>`
</code></pre>
<p>if (req.restarts == 0) {<br />
    set req.http.X-Forwarded-For = client.ip;<br />
}<br />
    `</p>
</p>
<h4>Are there some paid services or limitations?</h4>
<p>
<p>No, Antispam Bee is free forever, for both private and commercial projects. You can use it on as many sites as you want. There is no limitation to the number of sites you use the plugin on.</p>
<p>A complete documentation is available in the <a href="https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee/wiki" rel="nofollow">GitHub repository Wiki</a>.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:6053:"<h3>2.9.1</h3>
<ul>
<li>Improved backend accessibility</li>
<li>Prefilled comment textareas do now work with the honeypot</li>
<li>AMP compatibility</li>
<li>Improved dashboard tooltips</li>
<li>Improvements for the language detection API</li>
<li>Scalable IP look up for local spam database</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.9.0</h3>
<ul>
<li>Introduction of coding standards.</li>
<li>Switch to franc language detection API for the language check.</li>
<li>Do not longer overwrite the IP address WordPress saves with the comment by using <code>pre_comment_user_ip</code>.</li>
<li>Do not show &#8220;Trust commenters with a Gravatar&#8221; if the &#8220;Show Gravatar&#8221; option is not set.</li>
<li>Skip the checks, when I ping myself.</li>
<li>Fixes some wrong usages of the translation functions.</li>
<li>Use the regular expressions check also for trackbacks.</li>
<li>Add option to delete Antispam Bee related data when plugin gets deleted via the admin interface.</li>
<li>Save a hashed + salted IP for every comment</li>
<li>New check for incoming trackbacks.</li>
<li>Introduction of behat tests.</li>
<li>Updates the used JavaScript library for the statistics widget.</li>
<li>Bugfix in the &#8220;Comment form used outside of posts&#8221; option.</li>
</ul>

Member &#8211; User Profile &amp; Membership Plugin";s:4:"slug";s:15:"ultimate-member";s:7:"version";s:5:"2.1.2";s:6:"author";s:56:"<a href="http://ultimatemember.com/">Ultimate Member</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:45:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/ultimatemember";s:8:"requires";s:3:"5.0";s:6:"tested";s:5:"5.3.2";s:12:"requires_php";s:3:"5.6";s:6:"rating";i:86;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:660;i:4;i:47;i:3;i:20;i:2;i:31;i:1;i:101;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:859;s:15:"support_threads";i:465;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:440;s:10:"downloaded";i:3144005;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2019-12-04 9:26am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2015-01-21";s:8:"homepage";s:26:"http://ultimatemember.com/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:8408:"<h4>Best User Profile &amp; Membership Plugin for WordPress</h4>
<p>Ultimate Member is the #1 user profile &amp; membership plugin for WordPress. The plugin makes it a breeze for users to sign-up and become members of your website. The plugin allows you to add beautiful user profiles to your site and is perfect for creating advanced online communities and membership sites. Lightweight and highly extendible, Ultimate Member will enable you to create almost any type of site where users can join and become members with absolute ease.</p>
<h4>Features of the plugin include:</h4>
<ul>
<li>Front-end user profiles</li>
<li>Front-end user registration</li>
<li>Front-end user login</li>
<li>Custom form fields</li>
<li>Conditional logic for form fields</li>
<li>Drag and drop form builder</li>
<li>User account page</li>
<li>Custom user roles</li>
<li>Member directories</li>
<li>User emails</li>
<li>Content restriction</li>
<li>Conditional nav menus</li>
<li>Show author posts &amp; comments on user profiles</li>
<li>Developer friendly with dozens of actions and filters</li>
</ul>
<p>Read about all of the plugin&#8217;s features at <a href="https://ultimatemember.com" rel="nofollow">Ultimate Member</a></p>
<h4>Paid Extensions</h4>
<p>Ultimate Member has a range of extensions that allow you to extend the power of the plugin. You can purchase all of these extensions at a significant discount with our <a href="https://ultimatemember.com/pricing/" rel="nofollow">All Access Pass</a> or you can purchase extensions individually.</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/unsplash/" rel="nofollow">Unsplash</a> &#8211; Allow users to select a profile cover photo from <a href="https://unsplash.com/" rel="nofollow">Unsplash</a> from their profile</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/user-bookmarks/" rel="nofollow">User Bookmarks</a> &#8211; Allow users to bookmark content from your website</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/user-photos/" rel="nofollow">User Photos</a> &#8211; Allow users to upload photos to their profile</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/groups/" rel="nofollow">Groups</a> &#8211; Allow users to create and join groups around shared topics, interests etc.</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/private-content/" rel="nofollow">Private Content</a> &#8211; Display private content to logged in users that only they can access</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/instagram/" rel="nofollow">Instagram</a> &#8211; Allow users to show their Instagram photos on their profile</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/user-tags/" rel="nofollow">User Tags</a> &#8211; Lets you add a user tag system to your website</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/social-activity/" rel="nofollow">Social Activity</a> &#8211; Let users create public wall posts &amp; see the activity of other users</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/woocommerce/" rel="nofollow">WooCommerce</a> &#8211; Allow you to integrate WooCommerce with Ultimate Member</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/private-messages/" rel="nofollow">Private Messages</a> &#8211; Add a private messaging system to your site &amp; allow users to message each other</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/followers/" rel="nofollow">Followers</a> &#8211; Allow users to follow each other on your site and protect their profile information</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/real-time-notifications/" rel="nofollow">Real-time Notifications</a> &#8211; Add a notifications system to your site so users can receive real-time notifications</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/social-login/" rel="nofollow">Social Login</a> &#8211; Let users register &amp; login to your site via Facebook, Twitter, G+, LinkedIn, Instagram and Vkontakte (VK.com)</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/bbpress/" rel="nofollow">bbPress</a> &#8211; With the bbPress extension you can beautifully integrate Ultimate Member with bbPress</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/mailchimp/" rel="nofollow">MailChimp</a> &#8211; Allow users to subscribe to your MailChimp lists when they signup on your site and sync user meta to MailChimp</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/user-reviews/" rel="nofollow">User Reviews</a> &#8211; Allow users to rate &amp; review each other using a 5 star rate/review system</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/verified-users/" rel="nofollow">Verified Users</a> &#8211; Add a user verification system to your site so user accounts can be verified</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/mycred/" rel="nofollow">myCRED</a> &#8211; With the myCRED extension you can integrate Ultimate Member with the popular myCRED points management plugin</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/notices/" rel="nofollow">Notices</a> &#8211; Alert users to important information using conditional notices</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/profile-completeness/" rel="nofollow">Profile Completeness</a> &#8211; Encourage or force users to complete their profiles with the profile completeness extension</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/friends/" rel="nofollow">Friends</a> &#8211; Allows users to become friends by sending &amp; accepting/rejecting friend requests</li>
</ul>
<h4>Free Extensions</h4>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/forumwp/" rel="nofollow">ForumWP</a> &#8211; This free extension integrates Ultimate Member with the forum plugin <a href="https://forumwpplugin.com" rel="nofollow">ForumWP</a>.</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/terms-conditions/" rel="nofollow">Terms &amp; Conditions</a> &#8211; Add a terms and condition checkbox to your registration forms &amp; require users to agree to your T&amp;Cs before registering on your site.</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/google-recaptcha/" rel="nofollow">Google reCAPTCHA</a> &#8211; Stop bots on your registration &amp; login forms with Google reCAPTCHA</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/online-users/" rel="nofollow">Online Users</a> &#8211; Display what users are online with this extension</li>
</ul>
<h4>Theme</h4>
<p>Our official <a href="https://ultimatemember.com/theme/" rel="nofollow">theme</a> is purpose built for websites that have logged in and out users. The <a href="https://ultimatemember.com/theme/" rel="nofollow">theme</a> has deep integration with Ultimate Member plugin and the extensions, different header designs for logged-in/out users and works alongside the Beaver Builder and Elementor page builders.</p>
<h4>ForumWP</h4>
<p>In addition to Ultimate Member we also have another plugin called <a href="https://forumwpplugin.com/" rel="nofollow">ForumWP</a>. ForumWP is a forum plugin which adds an online forum to your website, allowing users to create topics and write replies. Forums are a great way to build and grow an online community.</p>
<h4>Development * Translations</h4>
<p>If you&#8217;re a developer and would like to contribute to the source code of the plugin you can do so via our <a href="https://github.com/ultimatemember/ultimatemember" rel="nofollow">GitHub Repository</a>.</p>
<p>Want to add a new language to Ultimate Member? Great! You can contribute via <a href="https://translate.wordpress.org/projects/wp-plugins/ultimate-member" rel="nofollow">translate.wordpress.org</a>.</p>
<p>If you are a developer and you need to know the list of UM Hooks, make this via our <a href="https://docs.ultimatemember.com/article/1324-hooks-list" rel="nofollow">Hooks Documentation</a>.</p>
<p>If you are a developer and you need to know the structure of our code, make this via our <a href="https://ultimatemember.com/php-docs/" rel="nofollow">Documentation API</a>.</p>
<h4>Documentation &amp; Support</h4>
<p>Got a problem or need help with Ultimate Member? Head over to our <a href="http://docs.ultimatemember.com/" rel="nofollow">documentation</a> and perform a search of the knowledge base. If you can’t find a solution to your issue then you can create a topic on the <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/ultimate-member">support forum</a>.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:264:"<ol>
<li>Activate the plugin</li>
<li>That&#8217;s it. Go to Ultimate Member &gt; Settings to customize plugin options</li>
<li>For more details, please visit the official <a href="http://docs.ultimatemember.com/" rel="nofollow">Documentation</a> page.</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:1288:"
<h4>Do I need to know any coding to use this plugin?</h4>
<p>
<p>No, we have built Ultimate Member to be extremely easy to use and does not require you to manually build shortcodes or have any coding knowledge.</p>
</p>
<h4>Is Ultimate Member mobile responsive?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes. Ultimate Member is designed to adapt nicely to any screen resolution. It includes specific designs for phones, tablets and desktops.</p>
</p>
<h4>Is Ultimate Member multi-site compatible?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes. Ultimate Member works great on both single site and multi-site WordPress installs.</p>
</p>
<h4>Does the plugin work with any WordPress theme?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes. Ultimate Member will work with any properly coded theme. However, some themes may cause conflicts with the plugin. If you find a styling issue with your theme please create a post in the community forum.</p>
</p>
<h4>Does the plugin work with caching plugins?</h4>
<p>
<p>The plugin works with popular caching plugins by automatically excluding Ultimate Member pages from being cached. This ensures other visitors to a page will not see the private information of another user. However, if you add features of Ultimate Member to other pages you have to exclude those pages from being cached through your cache plugin settings panel.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:102605:"<h4>Important:</h4>
<ul>
<li>To learn more about version 2.1 please see this <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/version-2-1-4/">topic</a></li>
<li>UM2.1+ is a significant update to the Member Directories&#8217; code base from 2.0.x. Please make sure you take a full-site backup with restore point before updating the plugin</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.1.2: December 4, 2019</h4>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Enhancements:</p>
<ul>
<li>Added text-type filters</li>
<li>Added sorting for filters, tagline and reveal section fields</li>
<li>Added universal hook for field&#8217;s wrapper and improve rendering the field wrapper attributes</li>
<li>Added returning only existed values for select-type filters</li>
<li>Added checking privacy for custom fields in filters and general search, exclude private fields</li>
<li>Added Form fields validation for E-mail( not unique )</li>
<li>Added $user_id attribute in update profile hooks for proper callbacks</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>Bugfixes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed fields privacy, editable and visibility attributes</li>
<li>Fixed member directory styles</li>
<li>Fixed random sorting</li>
<li>Fixed conflict with &#8216;php_data&#8217; variable in admin JS</li>
<li>Fixed datepicker/timepicker filtering in the member directories</li>
<li>Fixed initialization of datepicker, timepicker, slider filters when the &#8220;Show results only after search/filtration&#8221; option is active</li>
<li>Fixed callback select-type filters handlers on member directories filters bar</li>
<li>Fixed cover photo thumbnail sizes in member directory</li>
<li>Fixed Role filter</li>
<li>Fixed clearing filters with || condition</li>
<li>Fixed endless recursion in the function um_check_conditions_on_submit()</li>
<li>Fixed issue that appears if we try to update several plugins at once</li>
<li>Fixed using different templates for different member directories</li>
<li>Fixed form previews, added overlay and displayed buttons</li>
<li>Fixed wp-admin/admin-post.php access issue</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.1.1: November 12, 2019</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfixes:
<ul>
<li>Fixed admin actions hook</li>
<li>Fixed JS templates for list and grid view when user metakeys contain &#8220;-&#8221; symbol</li>
<li>Fixed JS template list &#8220;$show_block&#8221; issue</li>
<li>Fixed member directory search if &#8216;roles_can_search&#8217; is set</li>
<li>Fixed member directory filters bar animation</li>
<li>Fixed save profile with Last Login field</li>
<li>Fixed admin builder for profile form, show not editable fields</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.1.0: November 11, 2019</h4>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Enhancements:</p>
<ul>
<li>Added member directory list view</li>
<li>Added member directory search bar</li>
<li>Added member directory filters by range, date and time</li>
<li>Added AJAXed member directories</li>
<li>Updated member directories&#8217; search engine</li>
<li>Additional parameter &#8216;user_id&#8217; to action hook &#8216;um_user_after_updating_profile&#8217;</li>
<li>Added ability to set profile/cover image sizes from Ultimate Member -&gt; General -&gt; Uploads settings or Original size</li>
<li>Added ability edit cover photo HTML (e.g. for adding some HTML attributes. See how add srcset attribute based on all generated cover sizes <a href="https://docs.ultimatemember.com/article/1519-change-cover-photo-html" rel="nofollow">here</a>)</li>
<li>Added custom date format for Date Picker field</li>
<li>Added hook &#8216;um_show_meta_item_html&#8217; to customize user meta HTML at User Profile page</li>
<li>Added &#8220;aria-label&#8221; attribute in Field icon</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>Bugfixes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Optimized usermeta for Account submit security</li>
<li>Fixed flushing rewrite rules on every page reloading</li>
<li>Fixed Gmail &amp; Yahoo UTF-8 encoding of email notification subject</li>
<li>Fixed ajax_resize_image() process</li>
<li>Fixed country fields values</li>
<li>Fixed dynamic_profile.php notice</li>
<li>Fixed integration with WP native admin_post and admin_post_nopriv requests</li>
<li>Fixed profile image settings</li>
<li>Fixed profile privacy for not logged in users, if restriction options set for profile page as visible only for logged in and showing message instead of redirect<br />
(it makes the same for {site_url}/user and {site_url}/user/{user_slug} )</li>
<li>Fixed security issue on registration form submission when username or email have conditional logic</li>
<li>Fixed RTL styles issues on user profile and account pages</li>
<li>Fixed upload profile/cover photos at the profile page, don&#8217;t apply until the crop finished</li>
<li>Fixed alphabetical field validation for cyrillic and not UTF-8 symbols</li>
<li>Fixed user profile validation if username, username or email, password and email fields were added to form</li>
<li>Fixed user profile preview in admin Form Builder</li>
<li>Fixed getting templates function for some Windows servers</li>
<li>Fixed plugin update process for multisites</li>
<li>Fixed function &#8220;um_apply_conditions&#8221;. An error appears with jQuery v2.1.3</li>
<li>Localized um-raty.js library</li>
<li>Localized strings</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>

<li>Extended integration for UM field value</li>

<li>Tweak: added option to customize single-result text for members directory</li>

<li>Tweak: removed unnecessary js from admin head</li>
<li>Fixed: Account page is now translatable</li>
<li>Fixed: content restriction widget css in backend</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.29: January 28, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: added feature to show user display name in menu (e.g. Welcome, {display_name})</li>
<li>New: added option to add text to dividers (which can be added using the drag-and-drop form builder)</li>
<li>New: security improvement: added whitelisted IP(s) option to allow you to access the WP-admin screen always (prevents lockout)</li>
<li>New: added filter hook um_whitelisted_wpadmin_access to control access to wp-admin login screens (for developers)</li>
<li>New: added custom css option to apply extra css styling rules from plugin settings</li>
<li>New: added custom css option to each form allowing you to apply extra styling rules per form</li>
<li>New: added option to customize profile fields area width (per form basis) besides global option</li>
<li>Tweak: compatibility with default permalinks (Pretty permalinks are strongly recommended though!)</li>
<li>Tweak: improved the function that gets user IP address</li>
<li>Tweak: performance: inline css from the plugin is automatically compressed/minified</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.28: January 27, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: added compatibility with wpMandrill to handle email delivery</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue with profile edit menu not appearing</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.27: January 27, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: WP admin bar issue with some plugins and themes</li>
<li>Fixed: conflict with WP Recent Comments With Avatars plugin</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.26: January 26, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Important issue fix (update recommended)</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.25: January 26, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: addded support to use gravatars (optionally) If the user does not have a custom avatar</li>
<li>New: um_user_permissions_filter hook (for developer use)</li>
<li>Tweak: plugin uses get_avatar() properly now</li>
<li>Fixed: user avatars in backend are fixed</li>
<li>Fixed: Mobile_Detect class does not throw php error if it was previously called</li>
<li>Fixed: corrected a few translations errors</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.24: January 26, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak: predefined fields are now localized (translatable)</li>
<li>Fixed: PHP warning in comments was fixed</li>
<li>Fixed: avatars in comments</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.23: January 25, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: important bugfix with profile editing</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.22: January 25, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: option to set maximum profile fields area width</li>
<li>New: ajax functions for future development use</li>
<li>Tweak: improved profile permalinks for e-mail based usernames</li>
<li>Tweak: disable user from editing username (If admin put the username field by mistake in profile)</li>
<li>Tweak: minor css changes</li>
<li>Fixed: ability to clear conditional logic from fields in backend</li>
<li>Fixed: corrected spacing issue in a multi-column layout in profile</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.21: January 24, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Added ajax action hook for development use</li>
<li>New: Extended profile hooks</li>
<li>New: you can restrict / apply access control to woocommerce shop page</li>
<li>Fixed: content restriction for woocommerce shop page</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.20: January 24, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Custom email is sent to user after resetting/changing password</li>
<li>New: Added action/filter hooks to profile</li>
<li>Tweak: Improved a few core functions</li>
<li>Fixed: Encoding issue with non-english sites fixed</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.19: January 23, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Border thickness option for members directory</li>
<li>New: Option to show/hide forgot password link on login form</li>
<li>Tweak: Capital initials on members directory</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue with row styling in form builder</li>
<li>Fixed: Conditional logic bug fixes</li>
<li>Fixed: Icon for conditional rules in backend</li>
<li>Fixed: php warning in debug mode</li>
<li>Fixed: Mobile/phone number validation fixed</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.18: January 23, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Issue with drag and drop form builder</li>
<li>Fixed: Form builder trash icon in backend</li>
<li>Fixed: Minor css adjustments in frontend</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.17: January 22, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: WordPress Multi-site compatibility for user uploads and photos</li>
<li>Fixed: Searching members by username or email in directory (partial search supported)</li>
<li>Fixed: Anonymous tracking</li>
<li>Fixed: Minor css fixes</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.16: January 22, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Settings page: tracking popup removed</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.15: January 22, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: User profiles now show a cool message if the user profile field area is empty</li>
<li>New: Added &#8216;visibility&#8217; setting to all field types in backend</li>
<li>Tweak: Members search function supports partial search matching</li>
<li>Tweak: Deleting photo or file removes file from server</li>
<li>Tweak: Deleting a user will delete all his personal uploads from the server</li>
<li>Fixed: Duplicate tooltip for password field has been removed</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.10: January 22, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Template tags for welcome e-mail</li>
<li>Fixed: {submitted_registration} e-mail template tag</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.0: January, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>First official release!</li>

PDF Manager";s:4:"slug";s:15:"bsk-pdf-manager";s:7:"version";s:3:"2.5";s:6:"author";s:53:"<a href="http://www.bannersky.com/">BannerSky.com</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:40:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/bannersky";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.0";s:6:"tested";s:5:"5.3.2";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:92;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:24;i:4;i:0;i:3;i:1;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:2;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:27;s:15:"support_threads";i:1;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:0;s:10:"downloaded";i:96340;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2019-11-13 2:15pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2013-03-08";s:8:"homepage";s:45:"http://www.bannersky.com/bsk-pdf-manager-pro/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:999:"<p>Although the plugin called &#8220;PDF Manager&#8221; but it also can manage other files such as: pdf, zip, gz, rar, png, jpg, jpeg, gif, tif, tiff, swf, docx, xlsx, pptx, csv, crtfsv, pages, numbers, keynote, ies.</p>
<p>The plugin help you manage your PDFs / Files in WordPress. You may upload by categories and display by categories or show one special PDF / File.</p>
<p>It is easy to use. You just need add the shortcodes into the page / post where you want to show. Then it will show the PDFs / Files link in your page / post.</p>
<p>With widget feature you may show PDFs list in a widget area.</p>
<p>Please visit <a href="http://www.bannersky.com/bsk-pdf-manager/" rel="nofollow">https://www.bannersky.com/bsk-pdf-manager/</a> for documentations.</p>
<p>Check demos from: <a href="https://demo.bannersky.com/bsk-pdf-manager-demos/" rel="nofollow">https://demo.bannersky.com/bsk-pdf-manager-demos/</a></p>
<p>Pro version available now! You may upgrade to pro version for more features.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:1660:"<p>Activate the plugin then you can use either a shortcode [bsk-pdfm-pdfs-ul id=&#8221;ALL&#8221; order_by=&#8221;date&#8221; order=&#8221;DESC&#8221; target=&#8221;_blank&#8221;] to show all PDFs / Documents in date descending order. Or use [bsk-pdfm-pdfs-ul id=&#8221;8,9,10,11,12&#8243; target=&#8221;_blank&#8221;] to show special PDFs / Documents.</p>
<p>Check <a href="https://www.bannersky.com/document/bsk-pdf-manager-documentatio-v2/display-specific-pdfs-in-list/" rel="nofollow">here for more shortcode attributes</a> and <a href="https://demo.bannersky.com/bsk-pdf-manager-demos/display-all-specific-pdfs/all-pdfs-in-unordered-list-in-date-descending-order-open-in-new-window-with-pagination/" rel="nofollow">here for demos</a> about this shortcode.</p>
<p>You may use [bsk-pdfm-category-ul id=&#8221;1&#8243; show_cat_title=&#8221;yes&#8221; order_by=&#8221;date&#8221; order=&#8221;DESC&#8221;] to show all PDFs / Documents under the category of id 1 or [bsk-pdfm-category-ul id=&#8221;1,2,3&#8243; show_cat_title=&#8221;yes&#8221; order_by=&#8221;date&#8221; order=&#8221;DESC&#8221;] to show all PDFs under categories of id 1, 2, 3 in date descending order.</p>
<p>Check <a href="https://www.bannersky.com/document/bsk-pdf-manager-documentatio-v2/display-pdfs-by-category-in-list/" rel="nofollow">here for more shortcode attributes</a> and <a href="https://demo.bannersky.com/bsk-pdf-manager-demos/display-pdfs-by-category/display-pdfs-by-category-in-unordered-list-with-pagination/" rel="nofollow">here for demos</a> about this shortcode.</p>
<p>The plugin has a very easy admin page that allows you to manage categories and PDF documents.</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:6447:"<p>2.5</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Fixed the bug of target=&#8221;_blank&#8221; doesn&#8217;t work for category shortcodes</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Fixed the bug of wrong link for no category</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Backend interface improving</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Compatible with WordPress 5.2.4</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p>Pro version</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Support bulk change documents title</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Support bulk add documents from WordPress&#8217; media library</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Support recognize date from document file name</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Support only have category and keywords in search bar</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Fixed the bug of cannot use &#8220;add by FTP&#8221; when WordPress run on Windows server</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p>2.4</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Support extension filter</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Support show PDFs / Documents count description, use show_count_desc=&#8221;yes&#8221; in shortcode to enable it</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Fixed the warning message when edit a document</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Compatible with WordPress 5.2.2</p>
</li>
</ul>

<p>Remove PHP warnings</p>

<p>1.3.3</p>

<li>Changed order by parameter, now you may include orderby=&#8221;title&#8221; or orderby=&#8221;filename&#8221; or orderby=&#8221;date&#8221; to order all PDF, also can be order by PDFs&#8217; id sequence.</li>
</ul>
<p>1.3.2</p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed the bug of wrong output when category doesn&#8217;t have a PDF.</li>
</ul>
<p>1.3.1</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Widget supported now.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Support wordPress site with subdirectory installation.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Changed special PDF list from &lt;p&gt; tag to &lt;li&gt; tag, only return PDF link is possilbe. Support multiple PDF id and category id, so show all PDFs in one list is possible.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Changed backend interface.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p>1.3</p>
<ul>
<li>Support PDF list order by Date, Title and File Name.</li>
</ul>

</li>

<p>Hide category title when list PDF.</p>
</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>
<p>Add option to open PDF document in new window.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Show shortcode in Categories page and PDF Documents page. For convenience user just need copy and paste it to where you want to show the PDF documents.</p>
</li>
</ul>
